ref:
D: Can you just tell me a little bit about what brings you in here today? 

P: Yeah, I I have a cough.

D: OK, and uh, what kind of cough is it like a dry cough? Or is it more like productive cough?

P: I always seem to bring up some gunk on my when I cough.

D: OK, and what what colour is this gunk? 

P: It's green, sometimes yellowish.

D: OK, and have you noticed at all any kind of blood in the cough?

P: Well, no blood.

D: No, OK, and how much of the gunk or the sputum would you say you bring up every day?

P: Uh a couple of kleenexes. Um, I'll use, but so not that much. 

D: OK. an and when did this start?

P: It's really hard to say I've had a cough for the past few years now, but I feel like it's getting worse.

D: OK, and is your cough just constant or does it come and go?

P: I do cough throughout the day, but I find it's worse in the morning. 

D: OK, and is there anything that brings on your cough?

P: I can't think of anything that triggers the cough, just worse when I get up in the morning.

D: OK. And you mentioned you've been having this cough over the past few years. Has it been getting worse at all?

P: Yeah, I would say the coughs were getting worse the last few years. Slowly though.

D: OK, and have you had any previous episodes of this cough with sputum like gunk, gunky material before? 

P: Yeah, I've been having this ongoing for the last few years.

D: OK And is there anything that you do or have tried that's made your coughing get either better or worse?

P: If I take a deep breath, then it seems to make the cough worse and uh nothing really helps the cough go away though.

D: OK, um and other than that, have you been having any other symptoms, like a runny nose, sore throat, difficulty breathing, anything like that?

P: Uh, no.

D: OK, and have you recently traveled outside of the country?

P: I haven't traveled anywhere.

D: OK, and have you noticed any other symptoms like fevers or chills?

P: No fever and no chills.

D: OK, any night sweats?

P: No night sweats.

D: OK, any increased fatigue or just feeling tired overall?

P: Yeah, these last few months by energy has been low. I I've been feeling a lot more tired than usual. 

D: OK, and have you noticed at all any kind of swelling in your hands, feet, ankles?

P: Uh, I think they're always a little swollen, but I might have just gained a few pounds over the years.

D: OK and, have you been having any palpitations like a racing heart or any chest pain at all?

P: Um, no chest pain.

D: OK, and how about shortness of breath?

P: Um. I only have trouble breathing if I walk a few blocks or go up a few flights of stairs into my apartment.

D: OK. Have you been having any kind of urinary issues?

P: Ummm only at night time I seem to have to get up a lot to use the bathroom. 

D: OK, and how about your bowel movements, any constipation or diarrhea?

P: Um no bowel issues.

D: OK and have you been getting enough sleep?

P: Uh yeah I would say or sorry no my sleep has been has been poor

D: OK, and do you find that you wake up during the night to take a breath or anything like that?

P: No, I haven't had to wake up in the middle of the night short of breath or anything like that.

D: OK, and do you ever have to use a multiple pillows?

P: Um no I just used one pillow.

D: OK. And have you noticed you've had any significant weight loss or weight gain in the last few few months? 

P: Um I maybe lost 5 pounds in the last few months. I wasn't even, I haven't been trying to lose weight but doesn't hurt though as I've I've gained a few pounds over the years so I don't mind.

D: And how is your appetite been like?

P: Uh appetite's been good I feel like I've been eating normally.

D: OK. And have you had any recent infections at all?

P: No recent infections.

D: OK and I think I mentioned this before, but any know any runny nose sore throat, any of those viral symptoms?

P: Um, no runny nose, no sore throat, been feeling good.

D: Awesome, and have you had have you been exposed to anyone with tuberculosis in the past?

P: Um no, I actually had a tuberculosis test for work and it was normal.

D: OK. And have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions at all, like high blood pressure, diabetes?

P: Um my blood pressure has been high and that was diagnosed in the last few years.

D: OK. And do you take any medications for your blood pressure?

P: Yes, I take um, Lisinopril.

D: OK and do you have any allergies to any medications at all?

P: Nothing I can think of.

D: OK, and have you been hospitalized at all before?

P: Uh, no.

D: And do you have any ill contacts near anyone that has been sick around you recently? 

P: No ill contacts. And sorry I for hospitalizations I I did have a c-section for the birth of my daughter and I was in the hospital for a few days for that. 

D: OK, but nothing else? 

P: No. 

D: OK and have you had any other surgeries other than your c-section?

P: No just the c-section.

D: OK, in terms of your family history has anyone had any cardiovascular issues or any cancers?

P: Uh, my father had a heart attack when he was 78. And um he unfortunately passed away from it, but had no cancer in the family.

D: OK, any like asthma in the family?

P: Not that I can think of. 

D: OK, and currently, where do you live? Do you live in apartment, in a house? 

P: I live in an apartment with my husband and our daughter.

D: OK, and do you currently work?

P: Yeah, I I work at the local grocery store. 

D: OK. And just in your daily routine, how would you say, how is your diet and exercise like?

P: Um diet I'll usually eat one or two meals a day and sometimes snack throughout the day as well but we eat a variety of meats and vegetables, and so I think our diet is pretty good. But exercise don't have time for for that currently. 

D: OK, and do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

P: Um noo, I would never use that.

D: OK, how about alcohol?

P: A glass of wine. I have three or four nights a week.

D: OK, and is it like a full glass of wine or like just, how much would you say? 

P: Glass of Wine is for me. I would say is like 5 or 6 ounces like a typical glass of wine.

D: Do you smoke at all? 

P: I do smoke cigarettes, yes. 

D: OK, and how much are you smoking an average day?

P: Um over a pack, one to two packs of cigarettes per day for the last nearly 40 years.

D: OK OK alright.
pred:
D: Can you just tell me a little bit about what brings you in here today?
P: Yeah, I have a cough.
D: Okay, and what kind of cough is it? Like a dry cough, or is it more like a productive cough?
P: I always seem to bring up some gunk when I cough.
D: Okay, and what color is this gunk?
P: It's green, sometimes yellowish.
D: Okay, and have you noticed at all any kind of blood in the cough?
P: No blood, no.
D: Okay, and how much of the gunk or the sputum would you say you bring up every day?
P: A couple of Kleenexes I’ll use, but not that much.
D: Okay, and when did this start?
P: It's really hard to say. I've had a cough for the past few years now, but I feel like it's getting worse.
D: Okay, and is your cough just constant, or does it come and go?
P: I do cough throughout the day, but I find it's worse in the morning.
D: Okay, and is there anything that brings on your cough?
P: I can't think of anything that triggers the cough, just worse when I get up in the morning.
D: Okay, and you mentioned you've been having this cough over the past few years. Has it been getting worse at all?
P: Yeah, I would say the cough's been getting worse the last few years, slowly though.
D: Okay, and have you had any previous episodes of this cough with the sputum-like gunky material before?
P: Yeah, I've been having this ongoing for the last few years.
D: Okay, and is there anything that you do or have tried that's made your coughing get either better or worse?
P: If I take a deep breath in it seems to make the cough worse. Nothing really helps the cough go away though.
D: Okay, and other than that, have you been having any other symptoms like a runny nose, a sore throat, difficulty breathing, anything like that?
P: No.
D: Okay, and have you recently traveled outside of the country?
P: Haven't traveled anywhere.
D: Okay, and have you noticed any other symptoms like fevers or chills?
P: No, no fever or no chills.
D: Okay, any night sweats?
P: No night sweats.
D: Okay, any increased fatigue or just feeling tired overall?
P: Yeah, these last few months my energy has been low. I've been feeling a lot more tired than usual.
D: Okay, and have you noticed at all any kind of swelling in your hands, feet, or ankles?
P: I think they're always a little swollen, but I might have just gained a few pounds over the years.
D: Okay, and have you been having any palpitations, like a racing heart or any chest pain at all?
P: No chest pain.
D: Okay, and how about shortness of breath?
P: I only have trouble breathing if I walk a few blocks or go up a few flights of stairs into my apartment.
D: Okay, have you been having any kind of urinary issues?
P: Only at nighttime. I seem to have to get up a lot to use the bathroom.
D: Okay, and how about your bowel movements, any constipation or diarrhea?
P: No bowel issues.
D: Okay, and have you been getting enough sleep?
P: Sorry, no. My sleep has been poor.
D: Okay, and do you find that you wake up during the night to take a breath or anything like that?
P: No, I haven't had to wake up in the middle of the night short of breath or anything like that.
D: Okay, and do you ever have to use multiple pillows?
P: No, I just use one pillow.
D: Okay, and have you noticed any significant weight loss or weight gain in the last few months?
P: I've maybe lost five pounds in the last few months. I haven't been trying to lose weight, but it doesn't hurt though as I've gained a few pounds over the years, so I don't mind.
D: Okay, and how has your appetite been?
P: Appetite's been good. I feel like I've been eating normally.
D: Okay, and have you had any recent infections at all?
P: No recent infections.
D: Okay, and I think I mentioned this before, but any runny nose, sore throat, any of those viral symptoms?
P: No runny nose, no sore throat. Been feeling good.
D: Okay, and have you been exposed to anyone with tuberculosis in the past?
P: No, I actually had a tuberculosis test for work, and it was normal.
D: Okay, and have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions at all, like high blood pressure or diabetes?
P: My blood pressure has been high, and that was diagnosed in the last few years.
D: Okay, and do you take any medications for your blood pressure?
P: Yes, I take Lisinopril.
D: Okay, and do you have any allergies to any medications at all?
P: None that I can think of.
D: Okay, and have you been hospitalized at all before?
P: No.
D: And do you have any ill contacts near you, anyone that has been sick around you recently?
P: No ill contacts. Sorry, for hospitalizations, I did have a C-section for the birth of my daughter and I was in the hospital for a few days for that.
D: Okay, but nothing else?
P: No.
D: Okay, and have you had any other surgeries other than your C-section?
P: No, just the C-section.
D: Okay, and in terms of your family history, has anyone had any cardiovascular issues or any cancers?
P: My father had a heart attack when he was 78 and he unfortunately passed away from it, but no cancer in the family.
D: Okay, any asthma in the family?
P: Not that I can think of.
D: Okay, and currently, where do you live? Do you live in an apartment or a house?
P: I live in an apartment with my husband and our daughter.
D: Okay, and do you currently work?
P: Yeah, I work at the local grocery store.
D: Okay, and just in your daily routine, how would you say, how is your diet and exercise like?
P: Diet, I usually eat one or two meals a day and sometimes snack throughout the day as well, but we eat a variety of meats and vegetables, so I think our diet is pretty good. But exercise, don't have time for that currently.
D: Okay, and do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?
P: No, I would never use that.
D: Okay, how about alcohol?
P: A glass of wine three or four nights a week.
D: Okay, and is it like a full glass of wine or like just, how much would you say the glass of wine is for you?
P: I would say like five or six ounces, so like a typical glass of wine.
D: Okay, and do you smoke at all?
P: I do smoke cigarettes, yes.
D: Okay, and how much do you smoke in an average day?
P: Over a pack, one to two packs of cigarettes per day for the last nearly 40 years.
D: Okay, all right.
